name: Merveille Dona CODJO
title: AI Engineer
description:
I am a Master’s student in Artificial Intelligence at Université Paul Sabatier Toulouse III and a Research Intern at IRIT. I hold an engineering diploma in Telecommunications, providing me with a solid foundation in both theoretical and applied aspects of complex systems.

My academic background and research experience have fueled a deep interest in developing intelligent, reliable, and trustworthy AI systems. I have worked on predictive modeling for telecommunications applications and am currently gaining hands-on experience with large language models (LLMs). These experiences have broadened my skill set and strengthened my motivation to apply advanced AI techniques to real-world challenges, including but not limited to cybersecurity.

I am particularly interested in advancing AI research in areas such as threat detection, adversarial robustness, explainable AI, and secure, language-based interfaces.

projects.name: Energy Consumption Prediction in 5G Base Stations
projects.description: Developed a machine learning model using Python, XGBoost, and K-Means clustering to predict and optimize energy usage in 5G networks.

projects.name: LLM-Based Argument Mining (Research Internship)
projects.description: Gained hands-on experience fine-tuning and evaluating large language models (LLMs) for extracting structured information, with potential applications in cybersecurity.
